Thank you Felipe,

Best regards,

2018-05-30 0:19 GMT+01:00 Felipe Such fel=
ipe.such@... [neat] <
neat@yahoogroups.com>:

>
>
> Hi Rihab,
>
> Feel=
 free to reach out with any questions, we are glad people are
> interested =
on the paper and reproducing it's results.
> We are using NoFrameskip-v4. W=
e follow the same preprocessing steps as
> other methods (Example: https://=
github.com/openai/baselines/blob/master/
> baselines/common/atari_wrappers.=
py). We use the accumulated reward (no
> discount factor, no clipping).
> Y=
ou are right on the 20k frames limit as it translates to 5k timesteps
> aft=
er the frame skips.
>
> Best regard,
> Felipe
>
> On Tue, May 29, 2018 at 1=
:59 AM, Rihab Gorsane rihab.gorsane@...
> [neat] <neat@yahoogroups.=
com> wrote:
>
>>
>>
>> Hi all,
>>
>> I've begun reproducing the DeepNeuroev=
olution paper in Pytorch. I've
>> considered only the Atari case study to t=
est my algorithm on.
>> In the paper, it's mentioned that "During training,=
 each agent is
>> evaluated on a full episode (capped at 20k frames), which=
 can include
>> multiple lives and fitness is the final episode reward". Th=
us I think that
>> I need to track the number of frames each agent is proce=
eding and limit its
>> evaluation at 20k frames ( 5k frames for my case sin=
ce I'm doing k=3D4 frame
>> skipping technique for some games).
>>
>> I was=
 wondering if anyone could tell me which environment Uber was
>> wrapping (=
 -v0 or -v4, doing frame skipping or not) and also for the
>> reward, are t=
hey just picking the last reward as the fitness score or
>> calculating the=
 accumulated reward or doing some reward clipping.
>>
>> Thank you,
>>
>>
>=
 
>

--00000000000007b05a056d68625c
Content-Type: text/html; charset="UTF-8"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

<div style=3D"b=
ackground-color:#fff">

<div id=
=3D"m_1699904520117080958ygrp-mlmsg">
  <div id=3D"m_1699904520117080958ygr=
p-msg">


    <div id=3D"m_1699904520117080958ygrp-text">
      
      
   =
   <p></p><div dir=3D"ltr">Hi Rihab,<div><br></div><div>Feel free to reach =
out with any questions, we are glad people are interested on the paper and =
reproducing it's results.</div><div>We are using NoFrameskip-v4. We fol=
low the same preprocessing steps as other methods (Example: <a href=3D"http=
s://github.com/openai/baselines/blob/master/baselines/common/atari_wrappers=
.py" target=3D"_blank">https://github.com/openai/<wbr>baselines/blob/master=
/<wbr>baselines/common/atari_<wbr>wrappers.py</a>). We use the accumulated =
reward (no discount factor, no clipping).<br></div><div>You are right on th=
e 20k frames limit as it translates to 5k timesteps after the frame skips.<=
/div><div><br></div><div>Best regard,</div><div>Felipe<br></div></div><div>=
<div class=3D"h5"><div class=3D"gmail_extra"><br><div class=3D"gmail_quote"=
>On Tue, May 29, 2018 at 1:59 AM, Rihab Gorsane <a href=3D"mailto:rihab.gor=
sane@..." target=3D"_blank">rihab.gorsane@...</a> [neat] <s=
pan dir=3D"ltr"><<a href=3D"mailto:neat@yahoogroups.com" target=3D"_blan=
k">neat@yahoogroups.com</a>></span> wrote:<br><blockquote class=3D"gmail=
_quote" style=3D"border-left:1px #ccc solid">


<u></u>









 
<div sty=
le=3D"background-color:#fff">
<span>=C2=A0</span>


<div id=3D"m_1699904520=
117080958m_-173617515912917024ygrp-mlmsg">
  <div id=3D"m_16999045201170809=
58m_-173617515912917024ygrp-msg">


    <div id=3D"m_1699904520117080958m_-=
173617515912917024ygrp-text">
      
      
      <p></p><div dir=3D"ltr"><=
div>Hi all, <br></div><div><br></div><div>I've begun reproducing the De=
epNeuroevolution paper in Pytorch. I've considered only the Atari case =
study to test my algorithm on.=C2=A0</div><div>In the paper, it's menti=
oned that "During training, each agent is evaluated on a full episode =
(capped at 20k frames), which can include multiple lives and fitness is the=
 final episode reward". Thus I think that I need to track the number o=
f frames each agent is proceeding and limit its evaluation at 20k frames ( =
5k frames for my case since I'm doing k=3D4 frame skipping technique fo=
r some games). <br></div><div><br></div><div>I was wondering if anyone coul=
d tell me which environment Uber was wrapping ( -v0 or -v4, doing frame ski=
pping or not) and also for the reward, are they just picking the last rewar=
d as the fitness score or calculating the accumulated reward or doing some =
reward clipping.</div><div><br></div><div>Thank you,<br></div></div>
<p></p=
>

    </div>
     

    
    <div style=3D"color:#fff;height:0"></div>


<=
/div>



  






</div></div></blockquote></div><br></div>
</div></div><p>=
</p>

    </div>
     

    
    <div style=3D"color:#fff;height:0"></div>
=


</div>



  






</blockquote></div><br></div>
